result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Nelson is asking to modify the bond re contact with school. DA Hatch: no objection to request except it should be for the specific purpose/time. Court orders bond modification with exception as noted by DA.

No Contact with any River Falls School Buildings, Administrative Staff or K.C. except by written form for the purposes of employment related matters concerning benefits.
(Unless they address matters concerning her son)

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 4:00 pm.

3:48 PM Michelle L. Tietz in Court, Atty Nelson, DA Halle Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch states a PH is needed. Atty Nelson waives the PH. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: DE from PCJ

3:33 PM Defendant Michelle L. Tietz appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appeared in court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions non-appearance, DE did not receive the complaint. Court will quash the warrant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Complaint read aloud. Court reviews DE's rights. DE does not qualify for PD - PFAC. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 signature bond w/conditions of no contact w/RF School buildings, Admin. Staff or KC, no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:44 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
